abstract: Juliet Macur Sports of The Times column says that former San Francisco 49ers owner Edward J Debartolo, only owner to preside over team that won five Super Bowls, has fair chance to be elected into Pro Football Hall of Fame despite his past transgressions; notes that NFL fined and suspended Debartolo in 1990s for failing to report extortion attempt by former Louisiana governor Edwin Edwards.

headline.print_headline: A Gifted but Flawed Human Being Seeks a Spot Among the Immortals
headline.main: Eddie DeBartolo Jr., a Gifted but Flawed Human Being, Seeks a Spot Among the Immortals

snippet: DeBartolo, the former owner of the San Francisco 49ers, built one of the N.F.L.’s greatest dynasties. But his legal troubles aren’t helping his chances for the Pro Football Hall of Fame.
lead_paragraph: DeBartolo, the former owner of the San Francisco 49ers, built one of the N.F.L.’s greatest dynasties. But his legal troubles aren’t helping his chances for the Pro Football Hall of Fame.
